page.title: 03American Hobbies in the U.K.
page.content: One Day in France I saw some people{ {Break Dancing}on the pavement and so I decided to learn. The only problem was that no-one could teach me. So I just watched and copied what I saw. It took me about a year to get good enough to entertain over 200 people at a dicso. New moves are being made up all the time. For{Break Dancing}the clothes are very important, and so I became interested in what I wear. Now my friends describe me, in a joking way, as a 'poser'.{Break Dancing}also got me interested in music, and now I buy quite a lot of records and tapes. {Skateboarding}is still a cheap and enjoyable hobby which has been overtaken by{BMX-ing. BMX-ing}is based on entertaining crowds by performing tricks on special light and strong bicycles. You need a lot of expensive equipment and the right clothes.
